title: Numeric Input - Usage Examples
description: Common usage patterns and example configurations for number input fields with min/max validation, icons, and character limits

examples.name: Product Quantity (1-100, Validation)
examples.description: E-commerce product quantity selector with min/max validation to prevent invalid quantities
examples.visualDescription: Clean number input with up/down arrows (browser native), validates 1-100 range, cart icon

attributes.error: Please enter a quantity between 1 and 100.

examples.useCase: E-commerce product pages, order forms, wholesale inquiries, bulk purchase requests

validationRules.minNum: 1 - Minimum allowed value (cannot order 0 or negative)
validationRules.maxNum: 100 - Maximum allowed value (stock limit or bulk order cap)

bestPractices: Always set minNum to 1 for product quantities (0 makes no sense)
Set maxNum based on available stock or reasonable bulk limits
Use maxCount to prevent unrealistic values (3 chars = max 999)
Provide specific error message mentioning the valid range

ageVerificationNotes.minNum: 18 - Legal adult age in most countries (adjust to 21 for US alcohol)

warnings: Number field accepts any number in range - users can lie about age
For legal age verification, use nxt-date-field (birth date) instead
Browser autofill may not work for age fields (no autocomplete attribute)

validationRules.placeholder: Optional string - Example number or format hint
validationRules.reqTgl: Boolean - true for required fields, false for optional
validationRules.valNum: Boolean - true to enable min/max validation, false to allow any number
validationRules.minNum: String - Minimum allowed value (requires valNum: true)
validationRules.maxNum: String - Maximum allowed value (requires valNum: true)
validationRules.maxCount: String - Maximum number of characters/digits allowed (e.g., '3' = max 999)
validationRules.numImage: Object - {url, Id} for custom image (requires numIconType: 'image')
validationRules.uniqueid: String - Unique form field identifier for submission data

warnings: Number field only accepts INTEGERS - cannot handle decimals like 12.50 (use text field for prices with cents)
Browser number input shows up/down arrows (spinners) - may not match your design
Mobile keyboards show numeric keypad, but users can still type letters (browser dependent)
minNum/maxNum validation only works when valNum: true (otherwise any number allowed)
maxCount limits total characters, not the numeric value (maxCount: 3 allows -99 because '-' counts)
Number field does NOT format values - no commas (50000 not 50,000), no currency symbols ($500 not allowed)
Browser autofill may insert non-numeric characters (e.g., '(555) 123-4567' for phone)
Negative numbers allowed unless minNum >= 0 (set minNum: 0 to prevent negatives)
Scientific notation accepted (1e5 = 100000) which may confuse users
Leading zeros are removed by browser (00123 becomes 123)
commonMistakes: Using number field for phone numbers with formatting (use text field instead for (555) 123-4567)
Using number field for credit cards (use text field with pattern validation for spaces/dashes)
Using number field for prices with cents (12.99 requires text field, not number field)
Setting minNum without valNum: true (validation won't work)
Using maxCount alone without minNum/maxNum (doesn't prevent values like -999)
Forgetting that maxCount counts ALL characters including minus sign (maxCount: 3 allows -99)
Not providing specific error messages (use 'Enter a number between 1 and 100' not 'Required field')
Using number field for postal codes with letters (UK: SW1A 1AA requires text field)
Setting unrealistic maxNum (maxNum: 999999999 for age makes no sense)
Not testing mobile numeric keyboard behavior (varies by browser/OS)
bestPractices: Always set valNum: true if you have min/max requirements (otherwise validation won't work)
Use maxCount to prevent unreasonably large numbers (maxCount: 3 for quantities, 5 for team size)
Set minNum: 0 to prevent negative numbers for quantities, prices, counts
Provide descriptive error messages mentioning the valid range (minNum and maxNum values)
Use help text (hlpTxt + desctxt) to explain what the number represents and valid range
For age verification, set minNum: 18 (or 21 for US alcohol) and maxNum: 120 (reasonable max age)
For quantities, set minNum: 1 (can't order 0 items) and realistic maxNum based on stock
Choose appropriate icons: fas fa-shopping-cart (quantity), fas fa-dollar-sign (price), fas fa-users (team size)
Use 50% width (inpSz.md: 50) for paired fields (Team Size + Revenue side by side)
Always set inpSz.xs: 100 for mobile devices (stacks fields vertically)
For prices with decimals, use text field with pattern validation instead
For formatted numbers (phone, SSN, credit card), use text field with input masking
Consider using range slider for better UX when min/max are narrow (1-10 rating)
Use uniqueid that describes the field ('product_quantity', 'user_age', 'team_size') for backend processing
accessibilityNotes: Label (labelss) is required for screen readers to identify input purpose
Placeholder is NOT a replacement for label (screen readers may not announce it)
Use descriptive labels: 'Product Quantity' not just 'Number'
Help text (desctxt) provides additional context for assistive technology
Error messages (error attribute) are announced by screen readers when validation fails
Include min/max range in help text so screen reader users know valid values
Icons should be decorative only (don't rely on icon alone to convey meaning)
Ensure sufficient color contrast for icon colors (icnClr) - minimum 4.5:1 ratio
Number inputs work with keyboard navigation (up/down arrows adjust value)
Mobile numeric keyboard makes input easier for users with motor disabilities
performanceConsiderations: Browser native number validation is instant (no server round trip)
FontAwesome icons are lighter than custom images (vector vs raster)
valNum validation happens on blur and submit, not on every keystroke
Large maxNum values don't impact performance (validation is simple comparison)
Custom image icons should be optimized (<10KB) to avoid slowing form render

ECommerce.validation: Set maxNum based on available stock or bulk order limits

AgeVerification.warning: Number field only validates age value - users can lie. Use nxt-date-field for birth date to calculate actual age.

FinancialForms.tip: For budget/revenue WITHOUT decimals, use number field. For prices WITH cents ($12.99), use text field.
FinancialForms.validation: Set realistic min/max based on your pricing tiers

B2BLeadForms.tip: Team size (1-10000), Annual revenue (50000-10000000), maxCount to limit digits
B2BLeadForms.layout: Use 50% width for Team Size + Revenue side by side

SurveysAndRatings.tip: Use 1-5 for simple ratings, 1-10 for NPS (Net Promoter Score)
SurveysAndRatings.alternative: Consider visual star rating or slider for better UX than plain number input
